content:
• Monday, January 28, 2013
  • VMW

    VMware's (NYSE:VMW) weak Q1 guidance sparked an AH selloff in enterprise IT names. CTXS -3.1%....

    VMware's (NYSE:VMW) weak Q1 guidance sparked an AH selloff in enterprise IT names. CTXS -3.1%. RHT -2.2%. CRM -1.2%. WDAY -1.3%. FFIV -1.3%. NTAP -2.4%.The guidance comes amidst concerns the virtualization software market is becoming saturated, and that Microsoft's free Hyper-V platform is proving a tough competitor. On the earnings call, VMware boasted of strong vCloud sales, but added it's seeing soft demand in the U.S and remains worried about Europe. Headcount is expected to grow by 1K in 2013 in spite of the job cuts.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 PM | 2 Comments
  • STX

    Seagate (NASDAQ:STX) guided on its FQ2 call for FQ3 revenue of $3.25B-$3.45B, below a consensus...

    Seagate (NASDAQ:STX) guided on its FQ2 call for FQ3 revenue of $3.25B-$3.45B, below a consensus of $3.58B. Gross margin is expected to be at the low end of a range of 27%-32% after coming in at 27.8% in FQ2. "We're trying to give a conservative outlook, because our customers [PC OEMs] are giving us conservative input," says CFO Pat O'Malley. A $40M investment has been made in server flash memory module maker and Fusion-io (NYSE:FIO) rival Virident. STX -4.8% AH. WDC -2.6%. MRVL -1.4%. FIO -3.8%. (transcript) (WDC guidance)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 PM | 3 Comments
  • RCII

    Rent-A-Center (NASDAQ:RCII) Q4 results miss on all counts despite a slight uptick in total...

    Rent-A-Center (NASDAQ:RCII) Q4 results miss on all counts despite a slight uptick in total sales. Net profit fell 3.7% Y/Y as profit margins came under pressure due to expansion costs and a dip in same-store sales. For the current year, the company issues mixed guidance, expecting its EPS to come in betwen $3.25 to $3.40 on revenue growth of 5% to 8% - indicating a range of $3.24B to $3.33B. Street forecasts are for earnings of $3.49 on revenue of $3.28B.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:45 PM
  • FAF

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: FAF +6%. PCL +3%. WCRX +3%. MCRS +3%. GGP +2%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: FAF +6%. PCL +3%. WCRX +3%. MCRS +3%. GGP +2%.
    After-hours top losers: BMC -7%. EMC -5%. STX -5%. CTXS -4%. FIO -4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:43 PM
  • VMW

    More on VMware's (NYSE:VMW) Q4 results: Issues downside revenue guidance for Q1 and FY 2013;...

    More on VMware's (NYSE:VMW) Q4 results: Issues downside revenue guidance for Q1 and FY 2013; sees Q1 at $1.17B-$1.19B vs. $1.25 consensus, and 2013 at $5.23B-$5.35B vs. $5.43B consensus. Plans to streamline operations, including exiting certain lines of business and cutting ~900 employees; expects to result in total charges of $90M-$110M. Shares -13% AH; EMC, majority owners of VMW, -4.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:28 PM | 6 Comments
  • IDTI

    More on Integrated Device Technology (NASDAQ:IDTI): FQ3 top line misses estimates as revenue...

    More on Integrated Device Technology (NASDAQ:IDTI): FQ3 top line misses estimates as revenue declines 4% Y/Y on broad-based weakness in demand. Bottom line numbers met estimates, due in large part to reduced operating expenses and an improved product mix. The company lowers guidance going forward however, as near term visibility and demand appear limited. It now expects FQ4 sales in the range of $104M to $112M, below Street estimates of $120M. Shares -2.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:10 PM
  • NEU

    NewMarket (NYSE:NEU): Q4 EPS of $3.47 misses by $0.64. Revenue of $516.2M (+2% Y/Y) misses by...

    NewMarket (NYSE:NEU): Q4 EPS of $3.47 misses by $0.64. Revenue of $516.2M (+2% Y/Y) misses by $22.7M. Shares +2.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:06 PM
  • DLA

    Delta Apparel (NYSEMKT:DLA): FQ2 EPS of $0.01 misses by $0.17. Revenue of $106.8M (+1.2% Y/Y)...

    Delta Apparel (NYSEMKT:DLA): FQ2 EPS of $0.01 misses by $0.17. Revenue of $106.8M (+1.2% Y/Y) misses by $1M. Shares -2.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 PM
  • STX

    More on Seagate's (NASDAQ:STX) FQ2 earnings: "Seagate is executing well in an environment where...

    More on Seagate's (NASDAQ:STX) FQ2 earnings: "Seagate is executing well in an environment where customer demand forecasting is challenging," says CEO Steve Luczo. "In the first half of (fiscal) 2013, we returned over 95% of operating cash flows through share redemptions and dividends." Shares +2.1% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM | 2 Comments
  • WERN

    Werner Enterprises (NASDAQ:WERN): Q4 EPS of $0.35 in-line. Revenue of $509.7M (flat% Y/Y) beats...

    Werner Enterprises (NASDAQ:WERN): Q4 EPS of $0.35 in-line. Revenue of $509.7M (flat% Y/Y) beats by $0.43M. Shares -2.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • BMC

    BMC Software (NASDAQ:BMC): FQ3 EPS of $0.99 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $580M (+5.8% Y/Y) misses...

    BMC Software (NASDAQ:BMC): FQ3 EPS of $0.99 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $580M (+5.8% Y/Y) misses by $7M. Shares -7.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM
  • PCL

    Plum Creek Timber (NYSE:PCL): Q4 EPS of $0.49 beats by $0.20. Revenue of $354M (+12.3% Y/Y)...

    Plum Creek Timber (NYSE:PCL): Q4 EPS of $0.49 beats by $0.20. Revenue of $354M (+12.3% Y/Y) beats by $54M. Shares +2.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • SANM

    Sanmina (NASDAQ:SANM): FQ1 EPS of $0.29 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $1.49B (flat% Y/Y) misses by...

    Sanmina (NASDAQ:SANM): FQ1 EPS of $0.29 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $1.49B (flat% Y/Y) misses by $0.04B. Shares -3.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • AABA

    Yahoo (YHOO): Q4 EPS of $0.32 beats by $0.04. Revenue (ex-traffic acquisition) of $1.22B (+4%...

    Yahoo (YHOO): Q4 EPS of $0.32 beats by $0.04. Revenue (ex-traffic acquisition) of $1.22B (+4% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +3.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM | 5 Comments
  • VMW

    VMware (NYSE:VMW): Q4 EPS of $0.81 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $1.29B (+22% Y/Y) in-line. Shares...

    VMware (NYSE:VMW): Q4 EPS of $0.81 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $1.29B (+22% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -5.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • HLF

    The hits just keep coming to Herbalife (HLF -8.4%), as the shares sank into the close following...

    The hits just keep coming to Herbalife (HLF -8.4%), as the shares sank into the close following the FTC's announcement that regulators have seized the assets of Fortune Hi-Tech Marketing, alleging the company is a pyramid scheme. Although HLF wasn't mentioned in the announcement, Fortune Hi-Tech's Chief Analytics Officer, Simon Davies, worked at Herbalife for 11 years and was the company's Director of Internal Audit.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM | 12 Comments
  • LDK

    China is unlikely to impose tariffs on polysilicon imports despite an escalating trade depute...

    China is unlikely to impose tariffs on polysilicon imports despite an escalating trade depute that pits China vs. the U.S. and Europe, Maxim Group says, as a tariff would badly hurt China's own firms - including LDK, TSL, YGE, CSIQ - and harm global demand for price-elastic solar. As such, the recent rally in Daqo New Energy (DQ -6.4%) "has gotten ahead of itself."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM | 1 Comment
  • EGHT

    8x8 (EGHT -7.3%) shares are down today after inking a software licensing arrangement with...

    8x8 (EGHT -7.3%) shares are down today after inking a software licensing arrangement with CoSentry for its subscription-based Zerigo cloud software. Under the terms of the agreement, CoSentry will offer data services to clients in a number of markets across the U.S. In turn, EGHT will receive installation fees as well as an ongoing monthly subscription fee to use the software over a 12-month period in all CoSentry data centers.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM
  • ATE

    ADR's in Advantest (ATE -5%) take a hit today, responding to weakness in the stock during...

    ADR's in Advantest (ATE -5%) take a hit today, responding to weakness in the stock during Japanese trading overnight, on speculation that operating profit for the year ending March is going to undershoot expectations as it likely suffered an operating loss of ¥2B ($22M) in the last quarter due to slowing iPhone 5 sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM
  • IMGN

    ImmunoGen (IMGN -2.8%) slides after Oppenheimer cut the shares to Perform earlier today, saying...

    ImmunoGen (IMGN -2.8%) slides after Oppenheimer cut the shares to Perform earlier today, saying that the success of its current breast cancer drug T-DM1 is now fully priced into the stock. As with the launch any drug launch, initial Street expectations are adjusted, and a post-launch pullback into low teens may be seen over the near term.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM
  • DDD

    An alternative explanation for today's plunge in shares of 3D Systems (DDD -12.4%): Fellow...

    An alternative explanation for today's plunge in shares of 3D Systems (DDD -12.4%): Fellow 3D printer ExOne sets IPO terms at 5M shares at $14-$16 each. But Piper Jaffray's Troy Jensen is skeptical of competition concerns, noting just 2%-3% of DDD's total sales overlap with ExOne. "This is noise," Jensen tells Dow Jones. "I've never heard of ExOne until they filed." (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM | 15 Comments
  • TMO

    Life Technologies (LIFE -1%) slips on a downgrade to Neutral on valuation from UBS today. The...

    Life Technologies (LIFE -1%) slips on a downgrade to Neutral on valuation from UBS today. The firm is preaching caution because the stock has had a big run off takeover speculation, but it only sees a 60% chance of a deal at around $70, and 40% chance of no deal at all.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM
  • SPPI

    Spectrum Pharmaceuticals (SPPI -1.5%) slips after releasing safety findings from its Phase 2...

    Spectrum Pharmaceuticals (SPPI -1.5%) slips after releasing safety findings from its Phase 2 BELIEF trial of belinostat, a pan-histone deacetylase inhibitor. The trial showed the drug had an acceptable safety profile in patients with relapsed/refractory peripheral T-cell lymphoma, including patients who have received a previous allogeneic or autologous stem cell transplant. SPPI says an NDA filing is expected by mid-2013, and an FDA decision in 2014.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM | 3 Comments
  • JCP

    J.C. Penney (JCP -1.7%) will roll out hundreds of new sales in an effort to bring shoppers back...

    J.C. Penney (JCP -1.7%) will roll out hundreds of new sales in an effort to bring shoppers back into the fold. The news comes almost a year after the retailer announced a plan to cut around sales and promotions to go with a new pricing strategy. That move didn't sit so well with loyal JCP shoppers (to say the least) and the early buzz from traders is that the latest twist from the 4th heavily-shorted stock in the S&P 1500 isn't going to recoup anywhere close to the +20% of sales the company has lost.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:58 PM | 2 Comments
  • SODA

    SodaStream (SODA -3.5%) sees a little extra trading volatility after its initial Super Bowl is...

    SodaStream (SODA -3.5%) sees a little extra trading volatility after its initial Super Bowl is sent back to the company by CBS for being "too provocative" toward the bottle soda industry (KO, PEP, DPS-OLD, COT). Despite being forced to go with a back-up ad, the publicity from the rejection may end up helping the company and promote its David vs. Goliath image.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:29 PM | 5 Comments
  • CYTR

    CytRx (CYTR -2.4%) slips in spite of reporting overall positive results for its investigative...

    CytRx (CYTR -2.4%) slips in spite of reporting overall positive results for its investigative trial of aldoxorubicin, a tumor-targeting conjugate of the widely used chemotherapeutic agent doxorubicin in combination with unconjugated doxorubicin. The trial provided the basis for it's ongoing evaluation of Phase 1b trials using the combination therapy in cancer patients with advanced solid tumorsl. The results showed the drug well-tolerated with potential for treating of other chemotherapeutic-resistant tumors as well.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:21 PM
  • KERX

    Midday top 10 gainers: KERX +79%. FURX +51%. SHIP +39%. CTC +18%. HGSH +17%. SINO +14%. RSH...

    Midday top 10 gainers: KERX +79%. FURX +51%. SHIP +39%. CTC +18%. HGSH +17%. SINO +14%. RSH +12%. CPBC +11%. OCZ +11%. ACAD +10%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: NVGN -61%. RPRX -27%. JOSB -18%. TRMD-OLD -16%. BYFC -15%. JVA -12%. DDD -11%. PRCP -10%. SSYS -9%. AKS -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • DDD

    The swoon in shares of 3D Systems (DDD -10.7%) may be attributed to a Seeking Alpha post...

    The swoon in shares of 3D Systems (DDD -10.7%) may be attributed to a Seeking Alpha post claiming the ambiguity of the 3D printing market makes DDD, which has gained more than 260% in the last year, overvalued. Stratasys (SSYS -8.2%) has emerged as a formidable competitor in the 3D printing space, but its shares also trade lower in sympathy. Also, PRCP -11.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM | 17 Comments
  • ELGX

    Endologix (ELGX +2.3%) presents data from its clinical trial of a totally percutaneous approach...

    Endologix (ELGX +2.3%) presents data from its clinical trial of a totally percutaneous approach to endovascular abdominal aortic aneurysm repair, says the study demonstrated that the approach is non-inferior to surgical endovascular repair, and also has significantly reduced procedure times and time to hemostasis. The study also demonstrated positive trends toward lower blood loss, less need for pain medication, and shorter lengths of stay.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM
  • HES

    Hess (HES +5.1%) has "turned a corner" and is executing the right strategy, Oppenheimer's Fadel...

    Hess (HES +5.1%) has "turned a corner" and is executing the right strategy, Oppenheimer's Fadel Gheit says on its move to sell its fuel storage terminal network and exit the refining business, adding the terminals business may sell for as much as $1B. While UBS expects Hess to keep its retail presence, Edward Jones thinks exiting the lower-margin business would unlock further value.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM
  • CAT

    Some notes from the Caterpillar (CAT +2%) conference call: Q4 construction order pick-up was...

    Some notes from the Caterpillar (CAT +2%) conference call: Q4 construction order pick-up was largely due to dealers seeing 'light of day' on need for inventory reductions, as mining orders were slow. Anticipates better growth in FY13, but cautious on how quickly sales will benefit; U.S economic growth likely to come in at 2.5%, China at 8.5%. Europe however, will continue to struggle.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:17 PM
  • BIDU

    Baidu (BIDU +2.6%) is reiterated a Sell by Citi's Muzhi Li, who lowers his price target to $90...

    Baidu (BIDU +2.6%) is reiterated a Sell by Citi's Muzhi Li, who lowers his price target to $90 amidst increased competition from the likes of Qihoo 360 (NYSE:QIHU) which has already seized 10% of the search-engine market share. Nomura disagrees, noting Baidu still has an 80% share of the growing market.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM | 3 Comments
  • IDIX

    Idenix Pharmaceuticals (IDIX +11.4%) pops this morning after saying it's entered into a...

    Idenix Pharmaceuticals (IDIX +11.4%) pops this morning after saying it's entered into a non-exclusive collaboration with Janssen Pharmaceuticals for the clinical development of antiviral Hepatitis C vaccine combination therapies. The plans include an initial drug-drug interaction study to begin in the first quarter of 2013, followed by phase II studies pending approval from regulatory authorities.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:09 PM
  • RCPI

    Star Scientific (STSI -4.8%) refutes a story published last week on TheStreet.com in which...

    Star Scientific (STSI -4.8%) refutes a story published last week on TheStreet.com in which accusations are leveled at the firm that it misled investors over the involvement of Johns Hopkins University with research on the nutritional supplement anatabine. "The (anatabine) study was not sponsored by the Johns Hopkins School of Medicine, and the company never reported otherwise."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM | 18 Comments
  • HLF

    Shares of Herbalife (HLF -5%) go parabolic after the FTC announces a press conference today to...

    Shares of Herbalife (HLF -5%) go parabolic after the FTC announces a press conference today to discuss an alleged pyramid scheme. The conference will be held out of the Kentucky Attorney General's office in Lexington, Kentucky, and is scheduled for 1:00PM EST. It's not yet clear whether the conference has to do with HLF however, and the speculation is hitting the stock hard.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM | 2 Comments
  • SCCO

    Southern Copper (SCCO -3.7%) is downgraded to Underweight from Hold by BB&T, citing the...

    Southern Copper (SCCO -3.7%) is downgraded to Underweight from Hold by BB&T, citing the likelihood of reduced dividend payments, the stock's recent outperformance, a valuation that appears full on both an absolute and relative basis, expectations for negative free cash flow as it begins a major capex program, and the possibility of more labor strikes in Peru. Shares also are cut at Citi and J.P. Morgan.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM | 1 Comment
  • BIIB

    Biogen Idec (BIIB +2.8%) on a mixed Q4 report, missing on its bottom line but slightly beating...

    Biogen Idec (BIIB +2.8%) on a mixed Q4 report, missing on its bottom line but slightly beating on revenue. Net earnings actually fell 2.7% Y/Y, due largely to the company's preparations to launch its new multiple sclerosis drug BG-12, which masked revenue growth from its existing MS treatment. The company also boosted its FY13 revenue growth expectations to 10%. Analysts are looking for a 9% rise to $5.98B.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM | 1 Comment
  • PWAV

    Powerwave Technologies (PWAV -76.1%) files for bankruptcy protection after losing money in four...

    Powerwave Technologies (PWAV -76.1%) files for bankruptcy protection after losing money in four of the past five years. The maker of antennas and amplifiers for wireless communications lists debt of $396M and assets of $213M in its Chapter 11 filing.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM | 2 Comments
  • SD

    TPG-Axon calls for another review by "credible experts" of land deals involving a company run by...

    TPG-Axon calls for another review by "credible experts" of land deals involving a company run by the son of SandRidge Energy (SD -2.3%) CEO Tom Ward, as the slugfest between the two sides continues. "For the board to dismiss our concerns as 'entirely unremarkable' is in fact remarkable," says the hedge fund, which has already moved to replace Ward and other board members.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM | 3 Comments
  • JVA

    Coffee Holding (JVA -9.7%) trades lower on heavy volume after its FQ4 earnings report...

    Coffee Holding (JVA -9.7%) trades lower on heavy volume after its FQ4 earnings report underwhelms investors. The company only added two cents per share to it profit from a year ago.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM | 2 Comments
  • UNG

    Natural gas (UNG -4.1%) tumbles as Weather Group LLC revises its forecast and predicts...

    Natural gas (UNG -4.1%) tumbles as Weather Group LLC revises its forecast and predicts above-normal temperatures in the eastern U.S. from Feb. 7-11.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM | 12 Comments
  • RIG

    So who's a bully now? Carl Icahn steps up as the friend of Transocean (RIG +1.7%) investors as...

    So who's a bully now? Carl Icahn steps up as the friend of Transocean (RIG +1.7%) investors as the drilling rig contractor's largest shareholder, offering the hope of a $4/share dividend (it's now $0). Under Swiss law, a shareholder has the right to propose a dividend at a company's annual meeting, and if a majority of shareholders support it, the dividend is declared with or without board support.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM
  • IMMU

    Immunomedics (IMMU +3.3%) says its entered into an agreement with Algeta ASA (OTC:ALGZF) for the...

    Immunomedics (IMMU +3.3%) says its entered into an agreement with Algeta ASA (OTC:ALGZF) for the development of a potential cancer treatment using IMMU's humanized anti-CD22 antibody, epratuzumab. Under the terms of the agreement, IMMU will provide clinical-grade antibody to Algeta, which has rights to evaluate epratuzumab for the treatment of cancer. Algeta will fund all preclinical and clinical development costs up to the end of Phase I testing.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM | 1 Comment
  • BBBY

    Bed Bath & Beyond (BBBY -2.8%) slips after Goldman Sachs chops its rating on the retailer...

    Bed Bath & Beyond (BBBY -2.8%) slips after Goldman Sachs chops its rating on the retailer down to a Sell. Goldman thinks the retailer is losing market share and finding its margins slip as online pricing competition takes its toll.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM
  • PPG

    PPG Industries (PPG -3.1%) sets a final exchange ratio for the split-off of its commodity...

    PPG Industries (PPG -3.1%) sets a final exchange ratio for the split-off of its commodity chemicals business at 3.2562 shares of newly created Eagle Spinco for each PPG share. After PPG's acceptance, Eagle Spinco will merge with a subsidiary of Georgia Gulf (GGC +4.8%) and each Spinco share will convert to one GGC share; the closing of the merger then should conclude later today.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:20 AM
  • BKS

    Barnes & Noble (BKS -1.3%) trades lower after a plan to reduce a third of its stores over...

    Barnes & Noble (BKS -1.3%) trades lower after a plan to reduce a third of its stores over the next ten years is disclosed. Given a backdrop of a print book market which has lost 22% of its sales in five years and B&N's ongoing struggles to generate profits, the move makes sense to analysts.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM | 1 Comment
  • SCHS

    Shares of School Specialty (NASDAQ:SCHS) fall 72% after the company enters into an asset...

    Shares of School Specialty (NASDAQ:SCHS) fall 72% after the company enters into an asset purchase agreement with an affiliate of Bay Capital which will includes it filing for Chapter 11 bankruptcy. The sale is subject to a court-supervised auction to see if a higher offer is made.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM | 1 Comment
  • HES

    More from Hess (HES +6.7%): Elliott Associates tells the company of plans to buy up to $800M of...

    More from Hess (HES +6.7%): Elliott Associates tells the company of plans to buy up to $800M of its stock, and Hess says a law firm representing Elliott "also informed the company that Elliott is considering nominating candidates for election" to its board of directors. Hess earlier announced plans to close a refinery and sell its network of oil terminals.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:35 AM
  • FB

    Facebook (FB +1.1%) catches an upgrade to Buy from Raymond James' Aaron Kessler, who cites his...

    Facebook (FB +1.1%) catches an upgrade to Buy from Raymond James' Aaron Kessler, who cites his expectation for "Increasing monetization driven by mobile, new ad formats, and international."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM | 1 Comment
  • RPRX

    Repros Therapeutics (NASDAQ:RPRX) -6.7% premarket as it plans to release data from a clinical...

    Repros Therapeutics (NASDAQ:RPRX) -6.7% premarket as it plans to release data from a clinical trial of its Androxal treatment for secondary hypogonadism during Q3 instead of Q2 amid marked discrepancies in baseline sperm counts in the study. RPRX says it doesn’t expect the developments to affect the timing of its new drug application to the FDA.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM
  • JOSB

    A profit warning from Jos. A Bank (NASDAQ:JOSB) spills over to taint other men's clothing...

    A profit warning from Jos. A Bank (NASDAQ:JOSB) spills over to taint other men's clothing sellers. Shares of The Men's Wearhouse (MW) are down 3.5% premarket and Casual Male (NASDAQ:DXLG) is off 1.2%. JOSB has now lopped off 17.5% premarket after the retailer's admission that customers aren't responding to recent promotions begs the question: What's left?

     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM | 3 Comments
  • KERX

    Keryx Biopharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:KERX) +45.4% premarket on news its Zerenex experimental kidney...

    Keryx Biopharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:KERX) +45.4% premarket on news its Zerenex experimental kidney disease drug had met its late-stage trial goal of reducing phosphate levels in blood. KERX expects to submit a new drug application with the FDA and a marketing authorization application with the EMA for Zerenex in Q2.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM
  • FURX

    Premarket gainers: FURX +49%. KERX +46%. NTE +14%. SNE +7%. DOLE +7%. HES +6%. GGC +6%. ACAD...

    Premarket gainers: FURX +49%. KERX +46%. NTE +14%. SNE +7%. DOLE +7%. HES +6%. GGC +6%. ACAD +5%.
    Losers: JOSB -17%. MTG -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • AKS

    AK Steel (NYSE:AKS) -3.6% premarket after Goldman Sachs downgrades shares to Sell from Neutral...

    AK Steel (NYSE:AKS) -3.6% premarket after Goldman Sachs downgrades shares to Sell from Neutral with a $3 price target, down from $3.50. The firm believes the recent rise in the stock price is unwarranted given its view of continuing weak flat steel prices, a highly leveraged balance sheet, high pension funding requirements, high capex to fund its raw material strategy, and no sign of turnaround in its electrical steel business.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:57 AM
  • HES

    Hess (NYSE:HES) +5.4% premarket after announcing plans to sell its U.S. terminal network, which...

    Hess (NYSE:HES) +5.4% premarket after announcing plans to sell its U.S. terminal network, which has 28M barrels of storage capacity; Goldman Sachs to assist in the divestiture. HES also will complete its exit from the refining business by closing its Port Reading, N.J., refinery. HES says the moves will allow it to "redeploy substantial additional capital to fund... future growth opportunities."

     
     
     
     
    | 8:48 AM | 1 Comment

    More on Sony's (NYSE:SNE) rally (previous): Shares could be getting a lift from a report out of...
